history.content:
I'd recommend asking on the stat001 Piazza, but math 104 is listed as a prereq for Stat 210A so I'd recommend it. Also I'm not sure what you want a Master's in, but real analysis is probably the most important math upper div you could take for math and stats programs so I'd recommend that

(again though, you'll probably get a more informed answer by asking on the stat001 piazza)

children.subject: Is it doable to take Stat 210A with other tech classes, such as Math 170 and Stat 158?

A few thoughts about 210 here: https://piazza.com/class/jua820aaxcq1o6?cid=195

You must take 104 before 210a. 

This post lists the form you need to fill out if you're an undergrad wanting to take 210 with Fithian in the fall and he's strongly checking your math background before considering letting you in

From my experience, you don't need Math 104 to get into Stat 210A (that being said, it depends on how many people want to take it next semester). In the course, you don't need Math 104 either, as Stat 210A begins with introduction to measure theory. If you have strong math foundation and strong intuition for probability/statistics, not having Math 104 should not be your biggest deterrent.That said, I took the course without Math 104, and I could definitely have used a stronger proof background. But, the course was by far one of my favorites and it really lent me a new lens into looking at statistics! So, my advice would be less on do I need Math 104 to take Stat 210A, but more on what you want more in your final year: learn more mathematical rigor or learn more statistical rigor. 

The course is a graduate course, meaning there is little support compared to undergraduate courses. Also, do note that the course is very high workload (some homework can take 20+ hours). In my opinion, this blog post is fairly accurate of a description of what it's like to take Stat 210A! https://danieltakeshi.github.io/2016/12/20/review-of-theoretical-statistics-stat-210a-at-berkeley/

history.content: I'm a rising senior thinking about taking Math 104 or Stat 210A. I think I'd like to go on and get a Masters, and I want a solid background in math. But Stat 210A sounds really interesting, and it's related to the research I'm involved in. Which class is better?
history.subject: Math 104 or Stat 210A?
